This can reduce the need for chemical pesticides and make food more nutritious. Many experts argue the risks of GM foods are lower than those from conventional breeding techniques that involve more random genetic changes.

4. Consistent nutritional profiles: Studies comparing the composition of GM and non-GM crops have found no significant differences in nutrients, toxins, or allergens that would pose a safety concern. GM foods must meet the same safety and nutritional standards as conventional foods.
